comments.body: If the two sets of modules don't play well together, I'd recommend either listing both sets in full here (maybe a table?), or deprecating the old ones, or both.

It's more of a hypothetical that they won't work well together.

Both sets of modules do the same things: altering things in the cloud using the GCP APIs. Because they call the same APIs, I see no reason why you couldn't use the different modules at the same time. It just wouldn't be as pleasant of an experience.

used, but you may experience issues trying to use them together.

While the community GCP modules are not going away, Google is investing effort

comments.body: Is `us-central1` correct? It looks odd to my eye, like it should be `us-central-1` but maybe this is correct for GCP.
Yep, that's right! The GCP naming structure is a little different from AWS.

comments.body: Terraform has convenience fields - any chance we could leverage that for ansible and carry `image` forward?
Probably not. TF doesn't fully support this feature yet and you would lose the ability to have multiple disks with different images.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +274,278 @@============================  ==========================================  ======================
 state                        state/status                                State on gce has multiple values: "present", "absent", "stopped", "started", "terminated". State on gcp_compute_instance is used to describe if the instance exists (present) or does not (absent). Status is used to describe if the instance is "started", "stopped" or "terminated".
 image                        disks[].initialize_params.source_image      You'll need to create a single disk using the disks[] parameter and set it to be the boot disk (disks[].boot = true)
 image_family                 disks[].initialize_params.source_image      See above.
 external_projects            disks[].initialize_params.source_image      The name of the source_image will include the name of the project.

comments.body: The parameter mapping is helpful. An example playbook shown "before" and "after" would be a great addition.

I put in an example playbook which shows the loop concept. I think that's the hardest part of the transition. It doesn't show before/after as much because the parameter mapping shows all of the possible transitions in my opinion.
